summary: This is an email chain from February 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office personnel coordinating travel and conference room bookings for witness interviews related to the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). The emails reference multiple past trips for interviews in locations including Pensacola, Los Angeles, West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale, and Stockholm, Sweden.

events.title: Witness Interview in Pensacola
events.description: Travel by SDNY prosecutors to Pensacola, Florida, to interview a witness in the Epstein investigation. A conference room at the Hilton Garden Inn was booked for the interview.

events.title: Witness Interview near Stockholm
events.description: Planned travel by the prosecution team for an interview near Stockholm, Sweden, with an international element noted.

events.title: Witness Interview(s) in Los Angeles
events.description: Travel for an interview or possible interviews in Los Angeles.

events.title: Witness Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Travel for an interview in Los Angeles; no conference room needed for this trip.

events.title: Witness Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: Travel for an interview in West Palm Beach, Florida, with a request to reserve a conference room.

events.title: Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Travel for a victim interview in Los Angeles, with a request to reserve a conference room.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Travel for meetings and victim interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, with a request to reserve a conference room.

events.title: Travel Request for West Palm Beach
events.description: Travel request for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, for the case United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Florida
events.description: Initial travel request for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document is a series of email requests from 2019-2020 for travel approval and conference room bookings by SDNY prosecutors for the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618).
The investigation involved witness and victim interviews across multiple locations: Florida (Pensacola, West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale), Los Angeles, and internationally in Stockholm, Sweden.
The case is formally referenced as 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.'
The emails show a pattern of operational planning, with consistent requests for conference rooms at hotels to conduct interviews.
All personal names and email addresses of the prosecutors and staff involved are redacted in the released document.
